revised_title: On the Refraction-Equivalents of Elements and Their Deductions
tldr: This paper presents research on the refraction-equivalents of various elements and compounds. The author, J.H. Gladstone, compares the refraction-equivalents of different substances and discusses the specific refractive energy, which is a physical property independent of chemical theories. The study also highlights the relationship between the ability of metals to saturate other elements' affinities and their ability to slow down light rays.
